identificationModule.briefTitle: Mitigating Post-Op RV Dysfunction After LVAD Implantation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Protective Strategies to Mitigate Post-Operative Right Ventricular (PV) Dysfunction After Centrifugal Flow Durable Left Ventricular Assist Device (LVAD) Implantation

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This project evaluates right ventricle (RV) protective strategies after left ventricular assist device (LVAD) implantation.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The main purpose of this study is to learn more about protecting against RV dysfunction and RV failure (RVF) in patients receiving LVAD implantations.

This is a prospective, randomized controlled study that will include 20 patients with heart failure undergoing LVAD implantation. Patients will receive their LVAD implantation as part of routine care. Patients will be randomized 1:1 to one of two arms, 1) standardized RV management arm, and 2) usual care RV management arm, which are both consistent with standard of care (SOC).

armGroups.label: Standardized RV Management
armGroups.description: Physicians will follow prespecified parameters for RV management (consistent with SOC)

armGroups.label: Usual Care RV Management
armGroups.description: Physicians will use their own clinical judgement with no prespecified goals for RV management parameters (consistent with SOC)

interventions.name: Standardized RV Management
interventions.description: Standardized parameters for post-operative management (i.e., Rhythm Management, Ventilation Management, RV Ischemia Management, RV Preload, RV Afterload, RV Contractility, and RV Geometry)

interventions.name: Usual Care RV Management
interventions.description: No standardized parameters for post-operative management (i.e., Rhythm Management, Ventilation Management, RV Ischemia Management, RV Preload, RV Afterload, RV Contractility, and RV Geometry)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in right atrial pressure (RAP) pre-LVAD implantation to post-operative day 3
primaryOutcomes.description: RAP measured by pulmonary artery catheter

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in right atrial pressure (RAP) pre-LVAD implantation to post-operative day 7
primaryOutcomes.description: RAP measured by pulmonary artery catheter

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in right atrial pressure (RAP) pre-LVAD implantation to end of hemodynamic monitoring post-LVAD implantation
primaryOutcomes.description: RAP measured by pulmonary artery catheter
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, end of hemodynamic monitoring (about Day 10)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: RV failure defined by the 2014 Interagency Registry for Mechanical Circulatory Support (INTERMACS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The INTERMACS definition of RVF stratifies patients based on duration of inotropic therapy, inhaled nitric oxide therapy, vasodilator therapy or RVAD implantation. RVF is described as mild, moderate, severe, or severe acute based on ≤7, 8-14, \>14 days of the above therapies or RVAD implantation, respectively
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: RV failure defined by the 2020 Academic Research Consortium (ARC)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The ARC definition of RVF stratifies patients based on the onset of RVF (e.g. early acute right heart failure, early post-implant right heart failure, or late right heart failure) requiring inotropic therapy or RVAD implantation during LVAD implantation, \<30 days post-operatively, or \>30 days post-operatively, respectively
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation
Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation
Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Total time on inhaled nitric oxide
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of individuals who experience all-cause mortality
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of individuals with acute kidney injuries requiring renal replacement therapy
secondaryOutcomes.description: Acute kidney injury requiring renal replacement therapy (intermittent hemodialysis or continuous renal replacement therapy)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of individuals with transient ischemic attacks [TIA] or cerebrovascular accidents [CVA]
secondaryOutcomes.description: Transient ischemic attack or cerebrovascular accident as diagnosed by a Neurologist either clinically and/or radiographically
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of individuals with an arrhythmia requiring medical team intervention
secondaryOutcomes.description: Arrhythmia requiring medical team intervention, either through electrical or chemical cardioversion or any intravenous anti-arrhythmia medication administration
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of individuals who need tracheostomy
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of individuals needing percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy tube
secondaryOutcomes.description: Need for percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy tube
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through duration of hospitalization, up to 30 days following LVAD implantation

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age ≥ 18 years
* Undergoing durable LVAD implantation without plan for perioperative right ventricular mechanical circulatory support

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with pre-operative right ventricular mechanical circulatory support or having high likelihood of requiring right ventricular mechanical circulatory support.
* Patients with RV implantable cardiac device (ICD)/pacemaker lead who are pacemaker-dependent
* Pregnant patients
